jobs.title: Content marketing lead (b2b)
jobs.description:
B2B focused | HE Sector global audience/reach  | Reports and content writing | Newsletters | Blog

About Us

Blackbullion is the award-winning financial and education solution company on a mission to make the world money smart. Blackbullion can currently be accessed by students, through partners universities. A champion of tech for good, the platform is actively integrated into university student retention strategies, with a focus on widening participation students including: first-in-family, care leavers, single parents and students with disabilities.
About the Role

You will become our first inbound content marketer - to help with the majority of the marketing funnel for our company. You will be in charge of attracting site traffic, converting that traffic into new leads for the business, and nurturing those leads to close into customers, the latter of which sales leadership will help you accomplish. 

You will have a lot of ownership over our company blog, newsletters, infographics and white papers. As we are an education company working with universities, higher education sector experience would be beneficial. 


The Must-Haves
You have self-drive and motivation in spades, believe in the transformative power of education and - of course - be comfortable in a fast moving, dynamic startup environment
The ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical colleagues, customers, partners and investors is a must
You measure yourself by the impact you’ve made and the metrics you’ve moved
Your Skills 
Exceptional writing and editing skills, as well as the ability to adopt the style, tone, and voice of our business' various types of content.
Ability to optimize/scale blog marketing strategies and tactics based on data.
Can build and manage a rich content/editorial calendar that attracts a qualified audience 
Optimize our marketing automation and lead nurturing processes through email, content, and social channels
A passion and strong understanding of the industry and our business' mission. Previous experience within the sector would be beneficial.
Previous experience with marketing automation beneficial. 

Benefits

We are determined to build an amazing team, nurture great talent and offer a creative and collaborative workplace so you can take your passion, determination and tenacity and put it to work doing something you believe in.
Market rates salary and equity package
22 days of annual holiday + 3 extra days between Xmas and New Year 
Great company culture & actual work-life balance
Small and fun team, flexible working possible

This is a full-time role based in our offices based in WeWork. Closed tube station is old Street. Candidates must be eligible to work in the UK full-time without restriction.
